summary: The concept of "volcanic eruption" falls under the category of "deterioration of the environment" within EU legal and regulatory frameworks. Volcanic eruptions can lead to significant environmental degradation, impacting air quality, ecosystems, and human health. The EU has established various directives and regulations aimed at mitigating the effects of natural disasters, including volcanic activity. These legal instruments emphasize the importance of preparedness, risk assessment, and environmental protection. In the context of climate change and environmental sustainability, understanding volcanic eruptions is crucial for developing comprehensive strategies to manage their adverse impacts on the environment and public safety across member states.
